title: Plaine Perceuall the peace-maker of England Sweetly indeuoring with his blunt persuasions to botch vp a reconciliation between Mar-ton and Mar-tother. Compiled by lawfull art, that is to say, without witch craft, or sorcery: and referred specially to the meridian and pole artichoke of Nomans Land: but may serue generally without any great error, for more countries then Ile speake of.
author: Harvey, Richard, 1560-1623?
publisher: Printed in Broad-streete at the signe of the Pack-staffe [i.e. Eliot's Court Press for G. Seton,
notes: Signed on A4r: P.P.P., i.e. Plain Percevall Peace-maker, i.e. Richard Harvey. Sometimes attributed to Thomas Nash.
A satire in reply to the Martin Marprelate pamphlets.
The imprint is fictitious; printed in London in 1590 at Eliot's Court Press for G. Seton (STC).
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
